content.question: Which of the following is true of coalition government?

choices.label: It tends to result from a fragmented legislature and can be unstable.
It tends to result from a first-past-the-post voting system.
It is an ideal of majoritarian democracy.
It systematically excludes minority voices from government.
It has been a long-standing characteristic of British politics.

content.answer: It tends to result from a fragmented legislature and can be unstable.
